title: Digitalisation Notes
description: From basic concepts about data and processes through to digital operating models, platforms, governance and strategy.

levels.title: Digitalisation Foundations
levels.summary: Start with what digitalisation actually means, how data, people, processes and systems fit together, and how to read basic diagrams and operating models.
learningOutcomes: Explain what digitalisation is in plain language and how it differs from simple digitisation and automation.
Describe how data, processes and people fit together in a digital operating model.
Recognise common digital building blocks such as APIs, platforms and self service portals.
Relate digitalisation to basic ideas like value, customer journeys and system outcomes.

levels.title: Applied Digitalisation
levels.summary: Move into platforms, integration, data sharing, capabilities, and how organisations design digital journeys and services in practice.
learningOutcomes: Describe how digitalisation changes the way organisations plan, build and operate services.
Explain the role of data platforms, integration patterns and standards in a digital ecosystem.
Discuss real trade offs between speed, quality, risk and regulatory duties in digital projects.
Map simple end to end journeys and identify where digital changes can improve outcomes.

levels.title: Digital Strategy and Enterprise Scale
levels.summary: Look at digital roadmaps, operating models, governance, regulation and how to align data, architecture and people at sector or enterprise scale.
learningOutcomes: Connect digitalisation work to strategy, policy and long term investment decisions.
Explain how governance, architecture and product thinking support sustainable digital change.
Discuss how to measure digital outcomes using meaningful metrics rather than vanity numbers.
Describe real world challenges such as legacy systems, skills, regulation and vendor lock in, and how to work with them.

summaryPage.title: Digitalisation summary and games
summaryPage.description: A recap and playful space to join up digital concepts, platforms and strategy with small applied challenges.

targetAudience: People who want to understand digitalisation beyond buzzwords.
Students and professionals moving into data, digital or transformation roles.
Teams, lecturers and leaders who want structured notes, diagrams and tools for digital thinking.
